title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 December 2013 - XWiki
content:

09:07 <msmeria1> has quit

09:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <vmassol> good morning  
09:49 <vmassol> sending BFD results fro last week (I had forgotten) + new BFD email  
09:52 <vmassol> hmm actually I don't see any email  
09:53 <vmassol> nor any issue fixed  
09:53 <vmassol> for last week's BFD  
09:53 <vmassol> did I forget to send the reminder email?  
09:54 <vmassol> seems so… I'll consider that this one is BFD48 then  
09:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: that's weird I tough you had sent one  
09:55 <vmassol> me too  
09:55 <vmassol> I also thought that GD had fixed some issues  
09:56 <tmortagne> he did  
09:56 <tmortagne> I'm sure of that  
09:56 <vmassol> I did a jira query and couldn't find any  
09:58 <vmassol> maybe he had PR but they were applied later?  
09:59 <vmassol> has quit  
10:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <tmortagne> I remember applying one, but can't find any closed issue that day  
10:02 <tmortagne> note that there is lots of bugfixes that just don't have the label  
10:02 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/244  
10:03 <tmortagne> here it is  
10:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok for me to send BFD48 for today"s BFD?  
10:03 <tmortagne> the one I applied  
10:03 <vmassol> (I'm ready)  
10:03 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9774 does not have the label  
10:03 <tmortagne> I guess Guillaume forgot  
10:04 <tmortagne> added it  
10:04 <vmassol> improvement  
10:04 <vmassol> not bug  
10:04 <vmassol> at least that's what is mentioned  
10:04 <vmassol> we don't use bfd label for non bugs  
10:04 <vmassol> IMO it could be a big  
10:04 <vmassol> bug  
10:05 <vmassol> so what I propose:  
10:05 <tmortagne> did not even seen it was indicated improvement and I'm pretty sure we talked about it as a BFD item with Guillaume  
10:05 <vmassol> 1) we convert it to a bug so that it gets counted for GD in the overall BFD count  
10:05 <vmassol> 2) we don't post any result for last week's BFD  
10:06 <vmassol> 3) We do BFD48 today  
10:06 <vmassol> ok?  
10:06 <tmortagne> as you want  
10:06 <vmassol> ok doing it  
10:06 <tmortagne> we could mark the XAFORUM issue as BFD  
10:07 <tmortagne> since it was during the BFD  
10:07 <tmortagne> (and we say that extension are part of BFD too)  
10:07 <tmortagne> s/extension/extensions/  
10:08 <tmortagne> even if in this case I doubt those were fixed as part of the BFD  
10:08 <vmassol> we could, it's more work though  
10:08 <vmassol> so let's not do it for the past  
10:08 <vmassol> someone will need to update the query for BFD though  
10:08 <vmassol> wdyt?  
10:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: no, extension are already included in the query and always did  
10:09 <tmortagne> I was only talking about last BFD here  
10:09 <tmortagne> just setting the label in the issues  
10:09 <tmortagne> I'm not talking about reviewed all part BFDs  
10:10 <vmassol> actually we already do this  
10:10 <vmassol> type = Bug AND resolved >= "2013/12/18" AND resolved <= "2013/12/20" AND (keywords ~ bugfixingday OR labels in (bugfixingday)) ORDER BY resolution ASC, assignee ASC  
10:11 <vmassol> now what we coudl do  
10:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes this is what I said...  
10:11 <vmassol> is when the BFD manager sends the rsults  
10:11 <vmassol> he marks all bugs fixed on that day as BFD  
10:11 <vmassol> (it's easy to do so in jira in one go)  
10:12 <vmassol> hmmm there's a small problem actualyl  
10:12 <vmassol> timezones  
10:12 <vmassol> for example for today's BFD this query isn't correct:  
10:12 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/CURRIKI-6443?filter=12591&jql=type%20%3D%20Bug%20AND%20resolved%20%3E%3D%20%222013%2F12%2F18%22%20AND%20resolved%20%3C%3D%20%222013%2F12%2F20%22%20ORDER%20BY%20resolution%20ASC%2C%20assignee%20ASC  
10:12 <tmortagne> BFD queries are supposed to be on 3 days "resolved >= "2013/12/18" AND resolved <= "2013/12/20"" is not what we usually do  
10:13 <tmortagne> forget that last line  
10:13 <vmassol> I had added the margin around the date to accomodate different timezones  
10:13 <tmortagne> anyway for the issues we are talking about it's all french timezone  
10:13 <vmassol> epsecially sergiu  
10:13 <vmassol> (in the past)  
10:14 <tmortagne> I don't think we should set the label autiomatically  
10:14 <vmassol> ok  
10:14 <tmortagne> was just for the last BFD  
10:14 <vmassol> we've never done this in the past tmortagne  
10:14 <vmassol> so I don't think we should do it for the last BFD  
10:14 <vmassol> but we coudl start doing it startng from this BFD if we agree  
10:14 <vmassol> becuase if you do it for last BFD, why not do it for the BFD before that, etc  
10:15 <vmassol> also I don't have any report for last week's BFD ....

14:27 <DarkKnightCZ> what should responseContainer from XWiki.FileUpload widget be? simple div isnt enough (i need to disable showing server response)  
14:46 <tmortagne> Hi sburjan  
14:46 <sburjan> hi tmortagne  
14:46 <tmortagne> if you have some time it would be cool if you could retest XWIKI-9457 with a more recent version and see what are the remaining issues if any  
14:47 <tmortagne> with 5.3 for example  
14:47 <tmortagne> (getting warning about invalid extension before you upgrade is not an issue)  
14:48 <sburjan> from 5.2.2 to 5.3 is ok ?  
14:48 <tmortagne> sburjan: I think you need to test from 4.5.4  
14:48 <sburjan> ah ok  
14:48 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <tmortagne> XEM does not exist in 5.2  
14:50 <tmortagne> sburjan: same for XWIKI-9458  
14:50 <tmortagne> it's petty much the same use case from what I understood from your description so you can probably test both at the same time  
14:50 <msmeria> has quit  
14:50 <tmortagne> (same previous version and XEM in both cases)  
14:52 <sburjan> so you want me to confirm them again migrating to to 5.2.2 ?  
14:53 <tmortagne> no, migrating to 5.3  
14:53 <sburjan> ok  
14:53 <tmortagne> i.e. the version with all the possible fixes  
14:54 <tmortagne> I know there is stuff fixed in 5.3 that are not fixed in 5.2.2 but in both case I don't really know what is exactly the issue  
14:55 <tmortagne> sburjan: will assign them to you if you can't reproduce them anymore ;)  
14:56 <tmortagne> 2 BFDs for you :)  
14:56 <sburjan> ;) okay  
15:06 <sburjan> tmortagne: regarding XWIKI-9457, AFAIK the "upgrade all wikis" option does not work properly, this might be a possible cause. I will test with exactly the same scenario I described and see the results  
15:07 <tmortagne> sburjan: before the cause I would at least want to know what is the issue :)  
15:08 <tmortagne> most issues you had the first time have been fixed  
15:12 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, i guess {{html}} doesn't know html5 yet, right?  
15:13 <vmassol1> correct  
15:22 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you can always use clean="false" to make it not touch anything you put in its content  
15:22 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: nice  
15:23 <tmortagne> right now it make sure you have a valid XHTML 1.0 and some HTML5 stuff are not valid in XHTML  
15:26 <tmortagne> sburjan: just to be extra sure: you upgraded from XEM and not from XE in XWIKI-9458 ?  
15:27 <sburjan> yes, from XEM. I can't install Workspacestemplate on a vanilla 4.5.4 XE. I used XEM.  
15:28 <sburjan> so yes, 100% it's a 4.5.4 XEM  
15:28 <tmortagne> ok cool  
15:40 <tmortagne> sburjan: commented on XWIKI-9457  
15:40 <vmassol1> tmortagne: re 2) shouldn't it be shown as "invalid"?  
15:40 <vmassol1> (in red)  
15:40 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
15:40 <tmortagne> vmassol1: why invalid ?  
15:41 <tmortagne> there is no reason it does not work  
15:41 <tmortagne> all it's dependencies are there  
15:41 <vmassol> because the version is incompatible  
15:41 <vmassol> ah no my bad, it's the other way around  
15:41 <tmortagne> yes  
15:41 <vmassol> it requires 4.5.4 and we're on a 5.x  
15:41 <vmassol> so it's fine in this direction  
15:47 <vmassol> sburjan: click show details, it should list on which wikis it's installed  
15:47 <vmassol> it's normal that it's not installed in the main wiki  
15:47 <vmassol> it's an extension for subwikis  
15:47 <vmassol> so it's normal you get an install button for the main wiki  
15:47 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, I figuresd that out  
15:47 <sburjan> ah ok  
15:48 <vmassol> (talking about To53.png)  
15:49 <sburjan> vmassol: doesn't list on which wiki is installed  
15:49 <vmassol> I thought there was a line doing this  
15:49 <vmassol> let me check  
15:50 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not very clear because of XWIKI-9824  
15:50 <vmassol> there is  
15:50 <tmortagne> it looks like a not installed extension for sorin  
15:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: I know but if you click "sho details"  
15:50 <vmassol> you see all the namespaces where it's installed  
15:50 <sburjan> vmassol: http://postimg.org/image/o8z9mr7nb/  
15:51 <tmortagne> vmassol: read XWIKI-9824  again  
15:51 <tmortagne> no it's not listed, that's the whole point of that bug  
15:51 <vmassol> oh it's a regression?  
15:51 <tmortagne> yes  
15:51 <vmassol> because I'm looking on a 5.2.  
15:51 <vmassol> :)  
15:51 <tmortagne> yes  
15:52 <vmassol> sburjan: FTR this is what it looks like on 5.2: https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/620fc7a4-7f1c-464f-bed4-73fcac891aba/34af512cd729a33cc01c88e3cba11dd3  
15:53 <vmassol> so we're all good for this issue, cool :)  
15:53 <sburjan> I see. I don't have that for "Wiki Application for subwikis"  
15:53 <sburjan> okay  
15:53 <sburjan> tmortagne: should I close them both as "Won't fix" - Unable to reproduce ?  
15:54 <vmassol> closed already  
15:54 <tmortagne> sburjan:  I closed them already  
15:54 <tmortagne> won'tfix mean there is an issue we don't want to fix, here there is no issue anymore  
15:55 <sburjan> true. Thanks for the 2 issue :)  
16:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:31 <evalica> has quit  
16:31 <msmeria1> has quit  
17:07 <camil7> has quit  
17:07 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
17:30 <vmassol> has quit  
17:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hi, how to properly use abstractjobs logger? in MyJob extends AbstractJob i use this.logger.info/warn/error, but nothing is shown in logs  
17:48 <DarkKnightCZ> even if i put trace to everything in logback.xml  
17:48 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: the point of abstractjobs is to grab logs so that they don't show up in "system" logs but have their own storage instead that whatever UI display the progress can also display  
17:49 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, so where is the job storage?  
17:49 <tmortagne> you can find saved job statuses in data/jobs/status  
17:49 <tmortagne> but it's saved only when the job is done  
17:50 <tmortagne> there is no live save yet  
17:50 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, nice  
17:50 <tmortagne> it actually save the whole job status  
17:50 <tmortagne> not only the log  
17:50 <tmortagne> and since it's doing it using reflection it should saved whatever your status contains even custom fields  
17:51 <tmortagne> it's also loaded at startup to that you can access it later even after a restart  
17:51 <j-simard> has quit  
17:51 <tmortagne> (using JobManager)  
17:52 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
17:52 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, sadly i don't see my job in jobs/status folder  
17:52 <DarkKnightCZ> even grep didn't find it  
17:53 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: did you defined an id for your job ?  
17:53 <tmortagne> in the request  
17:53 <tmortagne> it's saved only if there is an id (to find it again later)  
17:54 <tmortagne> if you use DefaultRequest it's setId()  
17:54 <tmortagne> if you don't set an id you can still access it using JobManager but it's lost when restarting  
17:55 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, i haven't set id  
17:55 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
17:56 <DarkKnightCZ> it should be unique identifier for my job class, right?  
17:56 <tmortagne> not your job class, more your request  
17:56 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so it has to be unique when creating multiple jobs  
17:56 <tmortagne> for example you can have different id for the InstallJob  
17:57 <tmortagne> we put the extension id in the request id  
17:57 <tmortagne> basically your id is the path where it's going to be saved  
17:57 <tmortagne> so it's all about deciding what is allowed to overwrite what  
17:58 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, nice, thanks  
17:58 <GuillaumeF> has quit
